thread.title: Hundreds turn up for Queens funeral of EMS victim of Sept. 11
thread.title_full: Hundreds turn up for Queens funeral of EMS victim of Sept. 11 - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Hundreds turn up for Queens funeral of EMS victim of Sept. 11

organizations.name: fire department city of new york
fire department of the city of new york emergency medical services

text:
More than 200 FDNY members attended a funeral Monday in Queens for EMS Lt. Edith Torres, who died of a 9/11-related cancer.
Torres’ family gathered at St. Rita’s Catholic Church in Astoria, along with hundreds of FDNY members.
Fire Commissioner Daniel Nigro sat in the front row near parents Torres’ parents as well as her brother Jose Torres, a former police officer.
The emotional service began with a bagpipe procession. Firefighters and EMS members saluted the casket that was draped in the red, white and gold FDNY flag.
FDNY EMS hero dies of 9/11-linked cervical cancer 
EMS Lt. Edith Torres died of a 9/11-related cancer. (FDNY) Torres’ brother said that his sister had always wanted a career in emergency medicine.
“My sister is extremely, extremely intelligent. At one point she wanted to be a doctor, and she could’ve very well been. But she chose this path — or should I say the path chose her,” he said.
Torres’ taught her police officer brother how to perform CPR, he said, and the training once helped him save someone’s life.
Fire Department City of New York Commissioner Daniel Nigro arrives at a funeral for Fire Department of the City of New York Emergency Medical Services Lieutenant Edith Torres at St. Rita's Roman Catholic Church. (James Keivom/New York Daily News) “She had a strong will, a very strong will. She knew what she wanted, she told you what she wanted, and she made sure you knew what she wanted, and then she made sure you did what she wanted,” he said, to gentle laughter from the crowd.
“She had accepted what was going to happen to her. She had come to terms with it. She did not cry … She wanted everybody to know that she is OK,” he added.
Many extended Torres family members from Puerto Rico flew in to New York for the funeral service.
More than 200 FDNY members attended a funeral Monday in Queens for EMS Lt. Edith Torres, who died of a 9/11-related cancer. (James Keivom/New York Daily News) FDNY Chaplain Christopher Keenan said 9/11 deaths have become the department’s “new nightmare.”
Lieut. Torres is one of more than 100 FDNY deaths since 9/11, he said.
“(It’s) our new reality ... as the ravages of those toxic chemicals in our bodies since 9/11 take their effect,” he said.
Torres, 46, was among the first reponders who rushed into lower Manhattan on Sept. 11, 2001 when two planes struck the Twin Towers.
Torres’ partner at Battalion 49 in Astoria — Paramedic Carlos Lillo — was killed when the buildings fell, becoming one of the 343 FDNY members to die in the line of duty on 9/11.
